intro: Cuphea cyanea var. pubescens, commonly known as the velvet tamarind, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is part of the Lythraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators make it a valuable addition to botanical gardens and landscapes.
